DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._The way in which something is made, especially in terms of its different parts; its constituents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:The way in which something is made, especially in terms of its different parts; its constituents.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
The way in which something is made, especially in terms of its different parts; its constituents.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for initial GDC new CDE request. mc 8/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.
Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bone marrow sample containing a mixture of different types of stem cells, including hematopoietic stem cells, mesenchymal stem cells, and multipotent progenitor cells.

Concepts.definition: Bone marrow sample containing a mixture of different types of stem cells, including hematopoietic stem cells, mesenchymal stem cells, and multipotent progenitor cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.

Concepts.definition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state in which a substance has no tendency to flow under moderate stress; resists forces (such as compression) that tend to deform it; and retains a definite size and shape.: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: The state in which a substance has no tendency to flow under moderate stress; resists forces (such as compression) that tend to deform it; and retains a definite size and shape.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

Concepts.definition: The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is ordinarily present in the pleural space. It allows for normal movement of the lungs during respiration.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is ordinarily present in the pleural space. It allows for normal movement of the lungs during respiration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Peripheral Blood Component Not Otherwise Specified

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Peripheral Blood Component Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.::3: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.::3: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.: An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.

PermissibleValues.value: Mononuclear Cells from Bone Marrow Normal

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.: Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of immune cell that is made in the bone marrow and is found in the blood and in lymph tissue. The two main types of lymphocytes are B lymphocytes and T lymphocytes. B lymphocytes make antibodies, and T lymphocytes help kill tumor cells and help control immune responses. A lymphocyte is a type of white blood cell.

Concepts.definition: White blood cells formed in the body's lymphoid tissue. The nucleus is round or ovoid with coarse, irregularly clumped chromatin while the cytoplasm is typically pale blue with azurophilic (if any) granules. Most lymphocytes can be classified as either T or B (with subpopulations of each); those with characteristics of neither major class are called null cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of leukocyte with a multilobed nucleus and cytoplasmic granules. The unique morphology of the nucleus has led to their also being known as polymorphonuclear leukocytes (PMLs or PMNs). Granulocytes are subdivided according to the staining properties of their granules into eosinophils (red with acidic dye), basophils (blue with basic dye), and neutrophils (not amenable to staining with either acidic or basic dyes).

Concepts.definition: A type of leukocyte with a multilobed nucleus and cytoplasmic granules. The unique morphology of the nucleus has led to their also being known as polymorphonuclear leukocytes (PMLs or PMNs). Granulocytes are subdivided according to the staining properties of their granules into eosinophils (red with acidic dye), basophils (blue with basic dye), and neutrophils (not amenable to staining with either acidic or basic dyes).

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Changed to current NCIt definition per NMDP request. mc 9/9/2020

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.: A connective tissue cell that makes and secretes collagen proteins.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
A connective tissue cell that makes and secretes collagen proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A species of Herpetoviridae that is responsible for infectious mononucleosis (glandular fever). Discovered in 1964, this virus has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma in South African children and with nasopharyngeal carcinoma in Asian populations.: Laboratory methods used to generate cells that are able to reproduce indefinitely.

Concepts.definition: A species of Herpetoviridae that is responsible for infectious mononucleosis (glandular fever). Discovered in 1964, this virus has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma in South African children and with nasopharyngeal carcinoma in Asian populations.
Laboratory methods used to generate cells that are able to reproduce indefinitely.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.: A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.

Concepts.definition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.
A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.::1: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

Concepts.definition: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The mucosal membranes located on the inside of the cheek, in the buccal cavity.: One of the cells that cover the surface of the body and line its cavities.

Concepts.definition: The mucosal membranes located on the inside of the cheek, in the buccal cavity.
Any of the cells of the epithelium, which covers the body and lines its cavities and glands.

It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.: An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.

The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.

It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.: An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.
